intro: [WRONG START] Asteleia rapensis, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a perennial plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its tall, narrow leaves that can grow up to several meters in length. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white in color. Astelia rapensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional significance in Māori culture. Its fibrous leaves have been historically used for weaving and other crafts.
